summary: The Medellín Cartel was a powerful drug trafficking group from Medellín, Colombia, led by Pablo Escobar. It started in the 1970s and became the world's largest cocaine supplier. The cartel operated in many countries, making millions of dollars. They were known for their violence, bombing, and assassinations to avoid being sent to the U.S. for trial. Escobar's cousin, Gustavo Gaviria, was his main partner, handling logistics and shipping. The cartel's peak was in the 1980s, but it ended in 1993.
title: Medellín Cartel
